pros: Great corporate support for staff. Positive environment to work.
cons: It is non-unionized environment for nurses

pros: Great people work here, and they all seem to enjoy it for the most part. They really care about their patients from doctors to nurses all the way down to their IT staff.
cons: The departments are silo'd so you don't interact with each other which could be improved. Also the Meditech system they use is outdated and in much need for an update.

pros: Great Experience. Really learn a lot considering you are not a medical professional. Pay is very good for why you do.
cons: had too many part timers and it was hard to pick up the hours to make it worth staying there. Union job so be ready for people not to pull their weight.

review_title: Excellent learning experience, and a great job to have while looking for a job to start my career.
job_title: Unit Coordinating Assistant in Mississauga, ON
pros: The pay was really good, and the shift premiums are fair. CVH is non unionized, but keeps up with union standard pay rates. My manager allowed me to pursue my career goals by allowing me to reduce my hours to take an internship elsewhere.
cons: Working nights and weekends and holidays can get tiresome. But that's what you sign up for when you agree to be employed there.

review_title: not sure what this section means
pros: shift work allows for variety; breaks and lunches supported; good team members to discuss and share information with; new sections are very nice.
cons: parking issues and cost to pay for parking; open everyday which means having to work on weekends and holidays; stale air

review_title: Only if you can be in good books of othes you can get the job. Exprience and Skills do not matter.
pros: amazing experience as a co-op student. Learnt a lot.
cons: Politics - severe in  terms of Job opportunities. Somebody who had no accounting experience  and no skills was given the Contract position just because they liked her.  Could not believe this prevails in a organisation that raves about diversity and equal treatment.

pros: It is nice to have the freedom of shift work. Dealing with different patients everyday makes the day go by faster.
cons: Although most of the staff is great some of them do come across as rude. I am not sure if it is because of the stress of dealing with patients that are needlessly rude to you.

pros: answering phones, filing charts,employee rapport, opportunity, self-directed
cons: long hours, nice supervisor, good rapport with employee, flexible, too difficult of a job to do

pros: state of the art equipment, top professionals working there
cons: going through a lot of change, slow on the leadership change

pros: Enormous learning opportunity.Excellent quality of care provided.
cons: Working on shift is a requirement in certain areas.

job_title: Registered Practical Nurse in Etobicoke, ON
pros: good enviroment, clean units, fair pay
cons: less shifts, too many pateints to take care off

pros: Good benefits if you are a full time staff
